newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-BHP year net profit falls sharply.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-BHP year net profit falls sharply.

text.p: NOTE: The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd is a copper, energy, petroleum and steel group and is Australia'a largest listed company.

NOTE: BHP said the gross abnormal loss reflected a A$208 million gross writedown in its minerals unit, A$550 million writedown in some north American copper assets, A$332 million in steel plant closures and labour provisions and a A$124 million write-down in petroleum refinery assets. This was partially offset by a A$168 million abnormal profit from settlement of a tax issue and an abnormal income tax benefit of A$70 million.

NOTE: BHP said return on shareholders equity after abnormals fell to 3.3 percent in the 1996/97 year, compared with 8.6 percent a year earlier, while before abnormals it rose to 11.1 percent from 10.7 percent a year earlier.
Divisional earnings after tax and abnormals but before minority interests.
Net unallocated interest expense 382 vs expense 257
Corporate and unallocated loss 195 vs loss 148
